Description: Body sherd of Attic black-figured pottery open vessel, probably a krater, with handle root; interior: glazed streaky black with traces of two bands in added red; exterior: handle to left, siren with outspread wings to right (lower body and most of wings missing; traces of added white on face and neck and red on wings).
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Fitzwilliam Museum, Cambridge. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Bibliographic references: Venit 1982 / Painted Pottery from the Greek Mainland found in Egypt, 640-450 BC (p. 269, no. B204)
CVA Cambridge II / Corpus Vasorum Antiquorum: Great Britain, Fascicule 11, Cambridge, Fascicule 2 (p. 40, pl. XX, no. 16)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GA.1047)
